alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 26 at 9:29PM CDT until June 26 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MDT FOR WESTERN CHEYENNE AND SOUTHEASTERN KIMBALL COUNTIES... At 828 PM MDT, a confirmed tornado was located approximately 1 mile south of Kimball, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado and three inch hail. SOURCE...Off-duty NWS employee confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of western Cheyenne and southeastern Kimball Counties. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 23 and 24. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...3.00 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
